subject: RE: [junit] How to enable/disable JUnit tests programatically ?
msgSnippet: I needed the same thing and looked at the junit ext project… but found their implementation a little “weird”. So in my free time, I implemented a
messageBody:
I needed the same thing and looked at the junit ext project� but found their
implementation a little �weird�.



So in my free time, I implemented a configurable test filter based on system
properties. It can be found at http://github.com/bigmikef/junit-addons/.



It is just one class, and is really well documented. The class name is
org.junitAddOn.runners.SystemPropertyFilteredRunner. It is located in the
src/java directory.


Big Mike
